Pertussis (a.k.a wooping couph) is a serrious lung infection caused by the bacteria *B. Pertussis*.

The CDC tracks Pertussis case numbers in the US. The data is available at the following URL: http://tinyurl.com/pertussiscdc

We can "scrape" this data using the **datapasta** package.

```{r, include=FALSE}
cdc <- data.frame(
  year = c(1922L,1923L,1924L,1925L,
           1926L,1927L,1928L,1929L,1930L,1931L,
           1932L,1933L,1934L,1935L,1936L,
```

```{r}
head(cdc)
```
>Q1. Make a plot of pertussis cases per year using ggplot

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(cdc) +
  aes(x=year, y=cases) +
  geom_line()
```

>Q2. Let's add key milestones of DTP (wP) vaccine roll out in 1942 and the switch to the new aP vaccine in 1996.We can use `geom_vline()` for this. Booster shots started in 2004

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(cdc) +
  aes(x=year, y=cases) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 1942, col="blue")+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 1996, col = "red")+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2020, col="purple") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2004, col="grey")
```

There are high case numbers pre 1946 (before the wP vaccine) then relatively rapid decrease in case numbers through the 1970s and on to 2004 when our first wodespread outbreak occured again. 


Mounting evidence indicates that the aP vaccine induced immunity wanes faster than the older xP vaccine. 

Enter the CMI-PB Project 

## COmputational Models of Immunity Pertussis Boost

One of the main goals of this project is to determine what is different in the immune response between wP and aP primed individuals 


Using the booster vaccine as a proxy for inffection. 

All data is available here: https://www.cmi-pb.org/ in JSON format. 


```{r}
library(jsonlite)

subject <- read_json("https://www.cmi-pb.org/api/subject", simplifyVector = TRUE) 

head(subject)
```

>Q. How many individuals "subjects" are there in this dataset?

```{r}
nrow(subject)
```

>Q. How many aP and wP subject are there?

```{r}
table(subject$infacy_vac)
```


>Q. Male/Female numbers 

```{r}
table(subject$biological_sex)
```


>Q. breakdown of biological sex and race?

```{r}
table (subject$race,subject$biological_sex)
```

>Q. Does this look to be representative of the US population at large?

No. 


Let's read some more CMI-PB data 

```{r}
specimen <- read_json("http://cmi-pb.org/api/v5_1/specimen", simplifyVector = T)
ab_titer <- read_json("http://cmi-pb.org/api/v5_1/plasma_ab_titer", simplifyVector = T)

```



```{r}
head(specimen)
```
```{r}
head(ab_titer)
```


To use this data we need to *join* the various tables to find all the information I need to know about a particular measurement.

```{r}
library(dplyr)
meta <- inner_join(subject, specimen)

head(meta)
```

Now we can koin `meta` with `ab_titer` data.
```{r}
ab_data <- inner_join(meta, ab_titer)

head(ab_data)
```
>Q. How many different antibody isotypes are we measuring?

```{r}
table(ab_data$isotype)
```

>Q. How many differnet anigens?

```{r}
table(ab_data$antigen)
```


>Q. Let's look at a box plot of antigen levels over the whole dataset?

```{r}
dim(ab_data)
```
```{r}
ggplot(ab_data)+
  aes(MFI, antigen)+
  geom_boxplot()
  
```

>Q. Break this plot down by aP or wP.
Can have different color for each 

```{r}
ggplot(ab_data)+
  aes(MFI, antigen, col=infancy_vac)+
  geom_boxplot()
```
We can facet the plot by `infancy_vac`. 

```{r}
ggplot(ab_data)+
  aes(MFI, antigen)+
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~infancy_vac)
```


```{r}
ggplot(ab_data)+
  aes(MFI_normalised, antigen, col=infancy_vac)+
  geom_boxplot()
```

Let's focus on just IgG


```{r}
igg <- ab_data |> 
  filter(isotype =="IgG")
```



```{r}
ggplot(igg)+
  aes(MFI_normalised, antigen, col=infancy_vac)+
  geom_boxplot()
```

```{r}
head(igg)
```

```{r}
ggplot(igg)+
  aes(MFI_normalised, antigen, col=infancy_vac)+
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~visit)
```



Let's focus on PT(petussis Toxin) and igg levels over time

```{r}
table(ab_data$dataset)
```
Filter to focus on one antigen, PT, and IgG levels 

```{r}
pt_igg <- ab_data |> 
  filter(isotype=="IgG", antigen=="PT", dataset == "2021_dataset")
```

A plot of `actual days relative to boost ` vs `MFI _normalised`
```{r}
ggplot(pt_igg)+
  aes(actual_day_relative_to_boost, MFI_normalised, col=infancy_vac, group = subject_id)+
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = 14) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0)
  labs(titile = "IgG PT Levels", 
       xlab = "Days relative to Boost") +
    geom_smooth(method= "loess", se = T)
  
```


```{r}
ggplot(pt_igg)+
  aes(MFI_normalised, col=infancy_vac)+
  geom_boxplot()
  
```
